  • DescribeVpcPeeringConnections

  • DeleteVpcPeeringConnection

refs.DescribeVpcPeeringConnectionsOutput$VpcP: A collection of VPC peering connection records that match the request.

VpcPeeringConnectionStatus.base: Represents status information for a VPC peering connection. Status is associated with a VpcPeeringConnection object. Status codes and messages are provided from EC2 (see VpcPeeringConnectionStateReason). Connection status information is also communicated as a fleet Event.

refs.VpcPeeringConnection$Status: The status information about the connection. Status indicates if a connection is pending, successful, or failed.

refs.CreateGameServerGroupInput$VpcSubnets: A list of virtual private cloud (VPC) subnets to use with instances in the game server group. By default, all GameLift FleetIQ-supported availability zones are used; this parameter allows you to specify VPCs that you've set up.

refs.InstanceDefinition$WeightedCapacity: Instance weighting that indicates how much this instance type contributes to the total capacity of a game server group. Instance weights are used by GameLift FleetIQ to calculate the instance type's cost per unit hour and better identify the most cost-effective options. For detailed information on weighting instance capacity, see Instance Weighting in the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling User Guide. Default value is "1".

refs.CreateGameServerGroupInput$MinSize: The minimum number of instances allowed in the EC2 Auto Scaling group. During autoscaling events, GameLift FleetIQ and EC2 do not scale down the group below this minimum. In production, this value should be set to at least 1.
refs.CreateGameSessionInput$MaximumPlayerSess: The maximum number of players that can be connected simultaneously to the game session.
refs.CreateGameSessionQueueInput$TimeoutInSec: The maximum time, in seconds, that a new game session placement request remains in the queue. When a request exceeds this time, the game session placement changes to a TIMED_OUT status.
refs.CreateMatchmakingConfigurationInput$Addi: The number of player slots in a match to keep open for future players. For example, assume that the configuration's rule set specifies a match for a single 12-person team. If the additional player count is set to 2, only 10 players are initially selected for the match.
refs.EC2InstanceCounts$DESIRED: Ideal number of active instances in the fleet.
refs.EC2InstanceCounts$MINIMUM: The minimum value allowed for the fleet's instance count.
refs.EC2InstanceCounts$MAXIMUM: The maximum value allowed for the fleet's instance count.
refs.EC2InstanceCounts$PENDING: Number of instances in the fleet that are starting but not yet active.
refs.EC2InstanceCounts$ACTIVE: Actual number of active instances in the fleet.
refs.EC2InstanceCounts$IDLE: Number of active instances in the fleet that are not currently hosting a game session.
refs.EC2InstanceCounts$TERMINATING: Number of instances in the fleet that are no longer active but haven't yet been terminated.
refs.EC2InstanceLimit$CurrentInstances: Number of instances of the specified type that are currently in use by this AWS account.
refs.FleetUtilization$ActiveServerProcessCoun: Number of server processes in an ACTIVE status currently running across all instances in the fleet
refs.FleetUtilization$ActiveGameSessionCount: Number of active game sessions currently being hosted on all instances in the fleet.
refs.FleetUtilization$CurrentPlayerSessionCou: Number of active player sessions currently being hosted on all instances in the fleet.
refs.FleetUtilization$MaximumPlayerSessionCou: The maximum number of players allowed across all game sessions currently being hosted on all instances in the fleet.
refs.GameSession$CurrentPlayerSessionCount: Number of players currently in the game session.
refs.GameSession$MaximumPlayerSessionCount: The maximum number of players that can be connected simultaneously to the game session.
refs.GameSessionPlacement$MaximumPlayerSessio: The maximum number of players that can be connected simultaneously to the game session.
refs.GameSessionQueue$TimeoutInSeconds: The maximum time, in seconds, that a new game session placement request remains in the queue. When a request exceeds this time, the game session placement changes to a TIMED_OUT status.
refs.MatchmakingConfiguration$AdditionalPlaye: The number of player slots in a match to keep open for future players. For example, assume that the configuration's rule set specifies a match for a single 12-person team. If the additional player count is set to 2, only 10 players are initially selected for the match.
refs.MatchmakingTicket$EstimatedWaitTime: Average amount of time (in seconds) that players are currently waiting for a match. If there is not enough recent data, this property may be empty.
refs.PlayerLatencyPolicy$MaximumIndividualPla: The maximum latency value that is allowed for any player, in milliseconds. All policies must have a value set for this property.
refs.PlayerLatencyPolicy$PolicyDurationSecond: The length of time, in seconds, that the policy is enforced while placing a new game session. A null value for this property means that the policy is enforced until the queue times out.
refs.ResourceCreationLimitPolicy$NewGameSessi: The maximum number of game sessions that an individual can create during the policy period.
refs.ResourceCreationLimitPolicy$PolicyPeriod: The time span used in evaluating the resource creation limit policy.
refs.StartGameSessionPlacementInput$MaximumPl: The maximum number of players that can be connected simultaneously to the game session.
refs.UpdateFleetCapacityInput$DesiredInstance: Number of EC2 instances you want this fleet to host.
refs.UpdateFleetCapacityInput$MinSize: The minimum value allowed for the fleet's instance count. Default if not set is 0.
refs.UpdateFleetCapacityInput$MaxSize: The maximum value allowed for the fleet's instance count. Default if not set is 1.
refs.UpdateGameSessionInput$MaximumPlayerSess: The maximum number of players that can be connected simultaneously to the game session.
refs.UpdateGameSessionQueueInput$TimeoutInSec: The maximum time, in seconds, that a new game session placement request remains in the queue. When a request exceeds this time, the game session placement changes to a TIMED_OUT status.
refs.UpdateMatchmakingConfigurationInput$Addi: The number of player slots in a match to keep open for future players. For example, assume that the configuration's rule set specifies a match for a single 12-person team. If the additional player count is set to 2, only 10 players are initially selected for the match.

refs.CreateScriptInput$ZipFile:
A data object containing your Realtime scripts and dependencies as a zip file. The zip file can have one or multiple files. Maximum size of a zip file is 5 MB.

When using the AWS CLI tool to create a script, this parameter is set to the zip file name. It must be prepended with the string "fileb://" to indicate that the file data is a binary object. For example: --zip-file fileb://myRealtimeScript.zip.
